creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
LogFilePatternReceiver depends on jakarta-oro.  There are apparently no available tests to support 
refactoring it to use java.util.regex.  If it is revisited for bug 43141, adding unit tests and migrating to 
java.util.regex should be considered.

The java.util.regex requires a 1.4+ JVM.  I could not locate JVM requirements of the Jakarta-ORO project, but the code is old so this might very well support even Java 1.1.

If this changes the JVM requirement of the LogFilePatternReceiver class I think it should not go in a 1.2.X release.

Comments?
creator: thorbjoern@gmail.com

text: LogFilePatternReceiver is in the receivers companion which has not been formally released.  Since it is not in log4j 1.2, it does not need to support JDK 1.2 and 1.3 and migrating to javax.util.regex before release is an appropriate and desirable thing.
creator: carnold@apache.org

text: Fixed by Scott Deboy, rev 996096, change noticed added 996205.
creator: carnold@apache.org
